page.title: 03Housing in Pensilva.
page.content: Pensilva has many different kinds of homes. Several date from the{early {mining days}and are made of rough stone with wooden floors/ceilings and slate roofs.Most have been altered to add a bathroom.Others were built about {1900}for better off people.They used granite blocks for the walls and had larger rooms.Later still,in the{1930's some bungalows were built using metal windows and concrete blocks.After the war a council estate was built and then came the bungalow estates.Between {1968 and 1980}six estates with a total of{250 bungalows}were built,using the most modern ideas such as readymade parts,tiled roofs and double glazing. At the same time the District Council built an estate of bungalows for old people with a warden living nearby. {Tania Jane Webb. Donna Marie Hoare.
